唡字的基本解释

唡
（啢）
liǎng
y塶gli僴g
英美制重量单位，常衡一唡是一磅的十六分之一。亦作“英两”、“盎司”（中国大陆地区已停用此字，只用“盎司”）。

唡字的汉语字典释义

[①]［liǎng］［yīngliǎng］
“唡1”的繁体字。
英语ounce的旧译名，亦译作“盎司”。英美制重量单位。常衡以十六唡为一磅。药衡、金衡以十二唡为一磅。

Oh
Basic explanation of words
Oh
(ounce)
liǎng
y塶gli僴g
The Anglo-American unit of weight, Changheng is one sixteenth of a pound. Also used as "English Liang" and "oz" (this word has been disabled in mainland China, and only "oz" is used).
Oh
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［liǎng］［yīngliǎng］
Traditional characters for "唡1".
The old translation of English ounce is also translated as "ounce". Anglo-American unit of weight. Chang Heng uses sixteen 唡 as a pound. Yaoheng and Jinheng take twelve 唡 as one pound.
